messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using JavaScript and the Express.js framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `routes/userRoutes.js`, I found that `resetPassword` is imported to process HTTP requests to the path `/reset`. I'll provide you with the contents of file `routes/userRoutes.js`, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to find files that contain the implementation of `resetPassword`. You must focus on the implementation itself and ignore unit tests or functional tests. You need to output a list of paths to the files that contain the handler implementations, ensuring that each path is relative to the project's directory. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

Contents of file `routes/userRoutes.js`:

```
import express from 'express'
import { signin, signup, forgotPassword, resetPassword } from '../controllers/user.js'

const router = express.Router()

router.post('/signin', signin)
router.post('/signup', signup)
router.post('/forgot', forgotPassword);
router.post('/reset', resetPassword);

export default router
```

const SECRET = process.env.SECRET; 9 const HOST = process.env.SMTP_HOST 10 const PORT = process.env.SMTP_PORT 11 const USER = process.env.SMTP_USER 12 const PASS = process.env.SMTP_PASS 13 14 import User from '../models/userModel.js' 15 import ProfileModel from '../models/ProfileModel.js'; 16 17 18 export const signin = async (req, res)=> { 19 const { email, password } = req.body //Coming from formData 20 21 try { 22 const existingUser = await User.findOne({ email }) 23 24 //get userprofile and append to login auth detail 25 const userProfile = await ProfileModel.findOne({ userId: existingUser?._id }) 26 27 if(!existingUser) return res.status(404).json({ message: "User doesn't exist" }) 28 29 const isPasswordCorrect = await bcrypt.compare(password, existingUser.password) 30 31 if(!isPasswordCorrect) return res.status(400).json({message: "Invalid credentials"}) 32 33 //If crednetials are valid, create a token for the user 34 const token = jwt.sign({ email: existingUser.email, id: existingUser._id }, SECRET, { expiresIn: "1h" }) 35 36 //Then send the token to the client/frontend 37 res.status(200).json({ result: existingUser, userProfile, token }) 38 39 } catch (error) { 40 res.status(500).json({ message: "Something went wrong"}) 41 } 42 } 43 44 45 46 export const signup = async (req, res)=> { 47 const { email, password, confirmPassword, firstName, lastName, bio } = req.body 48 49 try { 50 const existingUser = await User.findOne({ email }) 51 const userProfile = await ProfileModel.findOne({ userId: existingUser?._id }) 52 53 if(existingUser) return res.status(400).json({ message: "User already exist" }) 54 55 if(password !== confirmPassword) return res.status(400).json({ message: "Password don't match" }) 56 57 const hashedPassword = await bcrypt.hash(password, 12) 58 59 const result = await User.create({ email, password: hashedPassword, name: `${firstName} ${lastName}`, bio }) 60 61 const token = jwt.sign({ email: result.email, id: result._id }, SECRET, { expiresIn: "1h" }) 62 63 res.status(200).json({ result, userProfile, token }) 64 65 } catch (error) { 66 res.status(500).json({ message: "Something went wrong"}) 67 } 68 } if(!mongoose.Types.ObjectId.isValid(_id)) return res.status(404).send('No user with this id found') 77 78 // const updatedUser = await User.findByIdAndUpdate(_id, formData, {new: true}) 79 // res.json(updatedUser) 80 // } 81 82 83 84 85 export const forgotPassword = (req,res)=>{ 86 87 const { email } = req.body 88 89 // NODEMAILER TRANSPORT FOR SENDING POST NOTIFICATION VIA EMAIL 90 const transporter = nodemailer.createTransport({ 91 host: HOST, 92 port : PORT, 93 auth: { 94 user: USER, 95 pass: PASS 96 }, 97 tls:{ 98 rejectUnauthorized:false 99 } 100 }) 101 102 103 crypto.randomBytes(32,(err,buffer)=>{ 104 if(err){ 105 console.log(err) 106 } 107 const token = buffer.toString("hex") 108 User.findOne({email : email}) 109 .then(user=>{ 110 if(!user){ 111 return res.status(422).json({error:"User does not exist in our database"}) 112 } 113 user.resetToken = token 114 user.expireToken = Date.now() + 3600000 115 user.save().then((result)=>{ 116 transporter.sendMail({ 117 to:user.email, 118 from:"Accountill ", 119 subject:"Password reset request", 120 html:` 121

You requested for password reset from Arc Invoicing application

122
Please click this link to reset your password
123

Link not clickable?, copy and paste the following url in your address bar.

124

https://accountill.com/reset/${token}

125

If this was a mistake, just ignore this email and nothing will happen.

126 ` 127 }) 128 res.json({message:"check your email"}) 129 }).catch((err) => console.log(err)) 130 131 }) 132 }) 133 } 134 135 136 137 export const resetPassword = (req,res)=>{ 138 const newPassword = req.body.password 139 const sentToken = req.body.token 140 User.findOne({resetToken:sentToken,expireToken:{$gt:Date.now()}}) 141 .then(user=>{ 142 if(!user){ 143 return res.status(422).json({error:"Try again session expired"}) 144 } 145 bcrypt.hash(newPassword,12).then(hashedpassword=>{ 146 user.password = hashedpassword 147 user.resetToken = undefined 148 user.expireToken = undefined 149 user.save().then((saveduser)=>{ 150 res.json({message:"password updated success"}) 151 }) 152 }) 153 }).catch(err=>{ 154 console.log(err) 155 }) 156 } ', 'stderr': ''}

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
- controllers/user.js

Explanation:
- The resetPassword handler is implemented in controllers/user.js as an exported function:
  export const resetPassword = (req, res) => { ... }
- This file is the implementation behind the route router.post('/reset', resetPassword) in routes/userRoutes.js.
- The resetPassword function reads the new password and token from the request body, finds the user by resetToken with a non-expired expireToken, hashes the new password, updates the user record, clears the resetToken and expireToken, saves the user, and responds with a success message.
